notes.text:
An update for jenkins-2-plugins is now available for Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform 3.11.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Important. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform is Red Hat's cloud computing Kubernetes application platform solution designed for on-premise or private cloud deployments.

Security Fix(es):

* jenkins-script-security: Sandbox bypass vulnerability in Script Security Plugin (CVE-2019-10431)

* jenkins-2-plugins: Stored XSS vulnerability in HTML Publisher Plugin (CVE-2019-10432)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
notes.title: Details

document.title: Red Hat Security Advisory: OpenShift Container Platform 3.11 jenkins-2-plugins security update

full_product_name.name: jenkins-2-plugins-0:3.11.1575261255-1.el7.noarch as a component of Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform 3.11

cwe.name: Improper Control of Generation of Code ('Code Injection')

notes.text: A sandbox bypass vulnerability in Jenkins Script Security Plugin 1.62 and earlier related to the handling of method names in method call expressions allowed attackers to execute arbitrary code in sandboxed scripts.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: CVE-2019-10393 jenkins-script-security-plugin: handling of method names in method call expressions allowed attackers to execute arbitrary code in sandboxed scripts
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
See the following documentation, which will be updated shortly for release 3.11.157, for important instructions on how to upgrade your cluster and fully apply this asynchronous errata update:

https://docs.openshift.com/container-platform/3.11/release_notes/ocp_3_11_release_notes.html

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2019-10400 jenkins-script-security-plugin: handling of subexpressions in increment and decrement expressions not involving actual assignment allowed attackers to execute arbitrary code in sandboxed scripts

notes.text: A flaw was found in the Jenkins Script Security plugin. Sandbox protection could be circumvented through default parameter expressions in constructors. This allowed attackers, able to specify and run sandboxed scripts, to execute arbitrary code in the context of the Jenkins master JVM. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality and integrity as well as system availability.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')

notes.text: Jenkins HTML Publisher Plugin 1.20 and earlier did not escape the project and build display names in the HTML report frame, resulting in a cross-site scripting vulnerability exploitable by users able to change those.
notes.title: Vulnerability description
